A new born was diagnosed as having a congenital abnormality that resulted in transposition of great vessels. While preparing the infant for surgery, the medical team needed to keep the ductus arteriosus open. They did this by infusing

Individuals with alcoholic cirrhosis of liver may develop severe hepatotoxicity after doses of acetaminophen that are not toxic to individuals with normal liver function. This increased sensitivity to acetaminophen’s toxicity is due to

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased activity of Cytochrome P450 enzymes

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease hepatocellular store of glutathione

questions.text: A college student is brought to emergency after taking an overdose of a non-prescription drug. The patient is confused and lethargic. He has been hyperventilating and dehydrated. Arterial blood gas analysis demonstrates metabolic acidosis. In the management of this patient, which is NOT likely to be of any therapeutic value

options.label: A
options.text: Likely to be more effective in rheumatoid arthritis

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Less likely to cause gastric ulcer and their complications

questions.text: A truck driver presented to the hospital with a minor soft tissue injury. Which of the following NSAID should not be prescribed to him?

Aspirin in low doses produces long lasting inhibition of platelet cyclooxygenase because

options.label: A
options.text: Platelet contain low quantity of COX

options.label: B
options.text: Platelets bind aspirin with high affinity

options.label: D
options.text: Platelets cannot synthesize fresh COX molecules

questions.correct_answer: D. Platelets cannot synthesize fresh COX molecules

questions.text: Which of the following patient characteristics is a possible reason for the use of celecoxib in the treatment of arthritis?

options.label: B
options.text: History of severe rash after treatment with a sulfonamide antibiotic

questions.correct_answer: A. History of peptic ulcer disease

questions.correct_answer: D. It tends to suppress both pain and vomiting in migraine

questions.text: Ergot alkaloid commonly used to prevent post-partum hemorrhage is

Two antihistaminics ,Terfenadine and astemizole were withdrawn from the market following the occurrence of cardiac arrhythmias when they were present in high levels in the blood. These effects were explained by the fact.

options.label: A
options.text: Treatment of these patients with erythromycin, a macrolide antibiotic

options.label: B
options.text: Use of these drugs by addicts

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic predisposition to metabolize succinylcholine slowly

questions.correct_answer: A. Treatment of these patients with erythromycin, a macrolide antibiotic

questions.text: H1 antihistaminics afford benefit in a number of conditions. All of the following conditions are benefited by antagonism of histamine EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits the synthesis of uric acid

options.label: B
options.text: Binds to tubulin and causes its depolymerisation

options.label: C
options.text: Colchicine blocks cell division by binding to mitotic spindles

options.label: D
options.text: Colchicine inhibits the synthesis and release of the leukotrienes

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibits the synthesis of uric acid

Ketoconazole should not be given to a patient being treated with astemizole because

options.label: A
options.text: Ketoconazole induces the metabolism of astemizole

options.label: B
options.text: Astemizole inhibits the metabolism of ketoconazole

options.label: C
options.text: Astemizole antagonizes the antifungal action of ketoconazole

questions.correct_answer: D. Dangerous ventricular arrhythmias can occur

questions.text: All of the following statements are TRUE about second generation antihistaminic agents EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: These do not impair psychomotor performance

options.label: C
options.text: These may possess additional antiallergic mechanisms

options.label: D
options.text: These possess high anti-motion sickness activity

questions.correct_answer: D. These possess high anti-motion sickness activity

Ergot alkaloid commonly used to prevent post – partum hemorrhage is

A 60-year-old male patient with chronic heart failure is prescribed a medication that acts by inhibiting the release of histamine from mast cells. Which of the following drugs is most likely being used in this patient?

A 50-year-old woman is prescribed a drug to manage her chronic allergy symptoms. This drug works primarily by inhibiting the synthesis of leukotrienes from arachidonic acid. Which of the following medications is she most likely taking?

A 40-year-old man with a history of peptic ulcer disease is prescribed a medication that acts as an antagonist of H2 receptors in the stomach. Which of the following medications is he most likely prescribed?
A patient with asthma is prescribed a medication that selectively inhibits the binding of histamine to H1 receptors. Which of the following drugs fits this description?

A 28-year-old woman with a history of severe menstrual cramps (dysmenorrhea) is advised to take a medication that inhibits the synthesis of prostaglandins. Which of the following is the most appropriate medication for her condition?

A 65-year-old man with hypertension and a history of heart failure is treated with an ACE inhibitor. He presents with a persistent dry cough, which is a known side effect of this class of drugs. The physician considers switching him to a medication that acts by inhibiting the action of angiotensin II. Which of the following medications should the physician prescribe?
A 50-year-old woman presents with chronic migraine headaches. She is prescribed a medication that acts as a serotonin receptor agonist. Which of the following medications is she likely to receive?

A 45-year-old man is diagnosed with allergic rhinitis and is prescribed a medication that is a selective H1 antagonist. He is concerned about sedation as he operates heavy machinery. Which of the following medications is least likely to cause sedation?
A 38-year-old woman with a history of asthma is started on a medication that blocks leukotriene receptors. Which of the following medications is she most likely prescribed?
A patient presents with anaphylaxis after a bee sting. The emergency physician administers a drug that is a non-selective adrenergic agonist. Which medication was most likely given?

A 55-year-old woman with a history of hypertension and chronic kidney disease is started on a new medication to help control her blood pressure. This medication also has a beneficial effect on preventing diabetic nephropathy by inhibiting the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system. Which of the following medications is she most likely prescribed?

A 60-year-old male with a history of chronic pain due to osteoarthritis is prescribed a medication that reduces pain and inflammation by inhibiting cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes. Which of the following medications is he likely to receive?
A patient experiencing severe allergic symptoms is treated with an antihistamine that does not cross the blood-brain barrier effectively. Which of the following medications fits this description?
A 72-year-old man with heart failure is prescribed a medication that acts as a selective beta-1 adrenergic agonist. Which of the following medications is he most likely to be prescribed?
A patient with a history of chronic migraines is considering preventive therapy. Which of the following medications is a serotonin reuptake inhibitor that can also be used for migraine prophylaxis?

A 50-year-old woman with obesity and a family history of cardiovascular disease is looking for a medication to assist with weight loss. After evaluation, her doctor prescribes a medication that works by reducing appetite and enhancing satiety through serotonin pathways. Which medication did the doctor prescribe?
